post_content_localized.en:
Get ready for a host of exciting theater when you discover what’s new to see on Broadway this spring. 

Each season, fantastic new shows and musicals open on Broadway in NYC. Whether you prefer singing and dancing, comedy, intense drama, or dazzling visuals, there’s something for everyone.

Highlights of Upcoming Broadway Shows

Mean Girls – Opening April 8, this production is a fun musical adaptation of the hit 2004 film comedy about rivalries among high school girls, written by Jeff Richmond and Nell Benjamin (music & lyrics), originated from the book written by Saturday Night Live alumni, Tina Fey. 

My Fair Lady – Opening April 19, brings back the classic musical version of Shaw's Pygmalion.

Summer: The Donna Summer Musical – Will open April 23. This musical biography showcases the career of Donna Summer, using the songs she made famous, including “Hot Stuff,” “On the Radio,” “Bad Girls,” and “MacArthur Park.”

Harry Potter and the Cursed Child Part 1 & 2- Opens on April 22. This original stage play continues the story of Harry Potter, his friends, and his son, in a time-traveling adventure to save the world from Voldemort.

There is so much more to see on Broadway in NYC this season! Enjoy a classic night of theater while you’re staying with us at The Manhattan Club. We're perfectly located in Midtown to provide convenience to the theater district, as well as a host of other NYC attractions.
